lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. Players Association will not appeal Albert Haynesworth’s five-game suspension for stomping on the head of Dallas center Andre Gurode last Sunday, leaving seven cuts requiring 30 stitches. Haynesworth, the Tennessee Titans defensive tackle, announced through his agent Tuesday that he would not appeal the ban. The Players Association executive director, Gene Upshaw, discussed the ban with Haynesworth and N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell.
